result.execSummary:
The defendant Genna J. Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Lincoln Co. Case Nos. 09CF211 & 09CF268

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate be probation.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Genna J. Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Genna J. Rivera in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty states agreement on the record.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions DE.   DE freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing.  Information filed.  DE enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists.   Court dismissed and read in Count 2. Court finds DE guilty of Count 1 and orders a withheld sentence and places DE on probation for 7 years consecutive to Lincoln Co. case Nos: 09CF211 & 09CF268 with conditions of: court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; Reimuburse Taylor Co. Sheriff's Dept. for $300.00; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. ba
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Genna J. Rivera in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Genna J. Rivera in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Waiving the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 11:15 am.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Genna J. Rivera appeared in court, in custody.  Court previously found probable cause through a court commissioner.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $2,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Statement by Defendant.  Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond; booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is April 12, 2016 at 1:00 pm  - rt
